update.description:
There's a lot going on here; sorry for the mish-mash. This pull request is to prepare for the bullet party.

1. Refactoring: move two tests related to revolute joints from physics.cc to joint_revolute.cc, nothing changed in the tests.

1. Add more expectations to the 494_joint_axis_frame test and partially fix the ODE and Bullet slider joints (GetGlobalAxis works, but the tests based on GetVelocity and SetVelocity aren't working yet, so they are commented out). Note that you need sdf 1.5 to actually run this test.

1. Add a bunch of expectations to the joint_spawn test, which are applied to every joint. There are a lot of problems here, even with ODE. This is verifying common directionality between GetVelocity, SetVelocity, SetForce, etc. ~~I think I've disabled the failing aspects of this test; I'll check Jenkins.~~ [Jenkins is clean](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-quantal-amd64-gpu-nvidia/310/).
update.title: Joint tests and some fixes

content.raw: Carlos, I'm going to merge this pull request now, since it has two approvals and then incorporate your code into a future pull request. Thanks!
content.html: Carlos, I'm going to merge this pull request now, since it has two approvals and then incorporate your code into a future pull request. Thanks!

1. Add more expectations to the 494_joint_axis_frame test and partially fix the ODE and Bullet slider joints (GetGlobalAxis works, but the tests based on GetVelocity and SetVelocity aren't working yet, so they are commented out). Note that you need sdf 1.5 to actually run this test.

update.title: Joint tests and some fixes

content.raw: I made some changes in a separate branch 7ce9e33 that make the test going a little further for the slider/prismatic joint. I found also that after a world::Reset(), I had to call world->Step(1) to get the expected value after _joint->GetAngle(). Not sure if that's the expected behavior.
content.html: I made some changes in a separate branch 7ce9e33 that make the test going a little further for the slider/prismatic joint. I found also that after a world::Reset(), I had to call world->Step(1) to get the expected value after _joint->GetAngle(). Not sure if that's the expected behavior.
